desc: Launch of Cancer Over Time on IARC Global Cancer Observatory website
Ms Harriet Rumgay on how alcohol consumption can cause cancer
Find out more about ovarian cancer around the world in our new story for #WOCD2021.
Around 1.2 million young adults (aged 20-39) were diagnosed with cancer globally in 2020, and 360,000 died from the disease.
Nordcan: version 9.0 is now available, including incidence, mortality, prevalence and survival in the Nordic countries up to and including 2018.
New estimates of the global burden of #cancer in 2020 now published in Cancer Today.
As part of the ICBP SURVMARK-2 study explored #ovariancancer survival by stage with the greatest differences seen in older women with advanced stage disease.
